content:
A Not So Normal Village




It was just another day in Normalville. The sun rose, the birds sang, the rooster cock-a-doodle-doo’d… Oh no, wait. That was just DeasVail. Let’s just move on, shall we?

Anyway, as usual, Fat_Tony rushed off to the markets to discuss the latest fashion trends, Senjai could be spotted chasing after his two young boys across town, and Slandaar remained unseen. Many in the village had never laid eyes on him, but it was assumed that he was the source of the screeching violin sound from within the most run-down house in town, hidden behind several layers of vegetation. The one thing that the villagers could always rely upon, however, was DeasVail being a complete and utter nuisance. He would throw glitter all over Fat_Tony’s clothes, initiate spontaneous, village-wide hide-and-seek games with Senjai’s boys and would prance around Normalville with his recorder, accompanying the overwhelmingly pleasant sound produced by Slandaar’s violin. Yes, it was just another day in Normalville.

The next day, the sun rose, the birds sang, and the villagers got on with their business as usual. Well, more pleasant than usual, but no one seemed to notice until Benmage paused his rambling and cried out.
“Where is DeasVail?”
No one paid him any attention at first, but eventually a low murmur seeped through Normalville as news of DeasVail’s disappearance spread. The villagers started searching for him and it wasn’t long before PeregrineV stumbled into the farmhouse and found his body. Well, what was left of it anyway.

DeasVail, Vanilla Townie, brutally murdered Night 0.

Each of the villagers displayed the same reaction to the sight, except for one. Choice casually strolled into the farmhouse, and with a giant grin on his face, said, “Well this is just absolutely fantastic! We'll finally be able to sleep in!”
Fat_Tony imagined how much nicer his clothes would look, Senjai thought of how much better his boys would behave and Slandaar, who watched the commotion from afar, revelled in the idea of being able to torture the village all by himself. Yes, beneath their masks of shock and horror, the villagers agreed that Normalville had just become a much nicer place to live.

Or hadn't it?

Rules

Moderator:

-I, DeasVail, am your moderator! I will handle any situations as I see fit.
-Feel free to PM me with any questions, complaints or mistakes I’ve made. Simple stuff like vote count errors can be mentioned in-thread.
-Any time you want my attention in-thread, please use bold.
-Action will be taken on rule infractions, whether it be a warning, force replacement or modkill.
-I may change the rules at any point in the game, although you will be notified.
-Flavour is for the purpose of entertainment only and will not be any indication of role or alignment.

General:

1) Have fun! And allow others to have fun too. Excessive insults or personal attacks will result in a warning or force-replacement.
2) There must be no talking about the game outside this thread, unless using a method allowed by your Role PM.
3) No editing of posts. Ever.
4) No quoting of any PMs or QTs relating to the game.
5) This is my colour. Don’t use it.
6) Do not discuss ongoing games.
7) Hydras are allowed, but no more than two heads, and they must be PM’d to me.
8) Once you are dead, there is to be no posting, except for a “Gah!” post with no game-related content.

Gameplay:

8) Votes must be bolded or in vote tag format to count. I will not count any that are not. Example: Vote: DeasVail Abbreviations can also be used as long as it’s clear who you’re voting for. Example: Vote: DV
9) Unvoting when changing a vote is helpful, but not required. Voting at the beginning of a line is also helpful, but not required, although not doing so increases the chance I will miss it.
10) Votes for a no lynch must be the following: Vote: No Lynch Vote tags are fine too.
11) A no-lynch before deadline requires at least 50% of votes. A lynch always requires a majority of votes.
12) Once a majority is reached, it becomes twilight until I can post the lynch. No voting or unvoting will count.
13) No majority at deadline means no lynch occurs.

Activity:

14) Please inform me if and when you will be V/LA. If I feel the period is too long or there is some other reason for me to do so, I will replace you.
15) Prods will be sent after 3 days (72 hours) without a post. If there is no response after another 24 hours, I will start looking for a replacement.
16) If someone accumulates 3 prods over the course of the game and I feel they are not active enough, they will be replaced.
17) Days last 2 weeks unless a lynch occurs before deadline or an extension is granted. Feel free to ask for them, but I will only grant one if it’s deserved.
18) Nights will generally last 48 hours.

Sample Vanilla Townie Role PM

Welcome DeasVail! You are a Vanilla Townie. You win when all threats to the town have been eliminated.

During the day you have the ability to post in the game thread and vote.

Please confirm by sending your role to me by PM.

The villagers began to leave the farmhouse to return to their regular activities, some barely keeping a smile from their faces.
“Don’t you see what this means? We’re not safe anymore!”
The villagers turned to see Papa Zito within the crowd, frustrated with their slow exit from the farmhouse.
“Oh…” Elias_the_thief said as he realised what Papa Zito meant. He was the obvious next target, as the villagers didn’t exactly adore him either.
What happened next was not unlike the dispersal of a hive of angry bees. Suddenly, the villagers took off, racing toward the main part of town as a group. They each shoved, pushed, stomped on each other’s toes in an effort to reach their home first.

Indeed, by midday, only thirteen- those too attached, scared or stupid to leave- remained.
“Now that we’re staying, we’d better work out who killed DeasVail,” Beyond_Birthday stated.

Day 1 has begun!

With 13 alive, it takes 7 votes to lynch.

First order of business is all this neighborizer nonsense. I think the speculation is actually pretty useless. There is generally at least one scum in the group, and a group with two out of three scum is rare. But its silly to throw out any possibility in favor of another merely based on statistics. Any mod can have any setup at any time. So to be honest I don't think its worth commenting on how many scum there may be in the group. I'm just gonna scrutinize ALL of their posts. Call me an equal opportunity scum hunter. That being said, the dichotomy between Chaos and BM is not necessarily a bad one, as it should force people to take sides early. I just don't like basing our lynches off of information we don't actually have.

As an aside, I kind of hate neighbors from a theoretical standpoint. Its a damn stupid role.

On Chaos vs BM - The discussion between Chaos and BM is hard to read without knowing the exact details of how Peregrin was trying to "break the game". Could someone please clarify this point? As I understand it, he was trying compare role PMs. But this can't be the sole justification for holding him town, can it? As I said I don't know the exact details, but couldn't this just as easily be interpreted as role fishing? Knowing the differences between a scum-neighbor PM and a town neighbor-PM seems like it would be incredibly useful to a mafiaso. I don't think its wise to assume he's town for trying to get information about your role.
Also, the exaggeration in post 21 (the "push that we were all town" comment) doesn't read town to me. I don't see a "push" from Omega but an attempt to recognize all opportunities. Combined with the fact that Chaos is actually actively scum hunting, I'm inclined to say BM is the scummier of the two. In fact, BM hasn't actually been saying all that much besides "ZOMG Chaos is scum based on PoE that only works from my standpoint, woooooo!".

I lurk as town, especially if I don't think I'll be able to post something worthwhile until I have more time to think about what to say. Perhaps in my other games I'm more into the game and don't need to do a lot of thinking to post coherently and effectively, while this game contains a lot fo new information which has to be digested and processed. Just a hypothetical that often applies to my own game-to-game lurking. Its a poor argument and one that I think should be disallowed, but that's neither here nor there. A lynch has been reached.

After the disappointment of the previous day and Code_X's tragic death, the villagers, desperate to catch the murderer, reach a majority quickly, deciding that PeregrineV is the target.

They repeat the same procedure as the previous day, hoping that it works out just as well as it did with Quagmire.
Surely PeregrineV is the murderer? they each think to themselves as vijay2vasandani and BK201 struggle to drag him to the stake.
"No townie would struggle so much! Remember what Quagmire was like," TeChNoWC shouts out to the crowd. His optimism is infectious and soon all the villagers are cheering BK201 and vijay2vasandani on, yet somehow, none of them think to lend a helping hand.

Nonetheless, although the sun has almost set once they are done, PeregrineV is eventually successfully tied and made ready for the burning. The villagers are more wild than ever as PeregrineV is set alight. They shout, they yell, they dance... until the screaming begins.
"This is almost as bad as Slandaar's violin," Benmage mutters to Elias_the_thief, and as expected they spot Slandaar, eyes closed and head nodding as if humming along to the fiery tune.
"Don't stop celebrating everyone. This is even further evidence that he was not like Quagmire!" TeChNoWC exclaims.

Once the deed is done, the villagers search PeregrineV's house and find that he was indeed unlike Quagmire. They uncover a journal reflecting on his experiences since DeasVail's death and learn that he had strived to find the murderer, not only for his own safety, but also for his neighbours, whom he had called great friends.

PeregrineV, Town Neighbour, has been lynched Day 2.

DLG, however, had experienced a similar thing 50 years before in a different town, and could not have been any less excited. Only he and one other had survived to catch the killers, and after the other's suicide, DLG had been left alone to reflect on the past and relive it. The wounded cries of innocent villagers wrongly lynched; discovering the mutilated bodies of others each morning; the regret in the eyes of each killer they burned.

DLG awakes, his sheet sticky with sweat, his blanket suffocating, his room empty.
Better me than someone else, he thinks.

DLG, Vanilla Townie, has been killed Night 2.

vijay2vasandani, Mafia Goon, has been lynched Day 3.

The villagers are elated. They each suddenly become aware of the the comforting warmth of the sun, the harmonious tune sung by the birds, the aroma of thriving flowers. Smiles are exchanged and conversation begins.

I was not alone.

The villagers eye each other with renewed suspicion, their lips sealed and faces guarded. The sun makes their necks prickle, the birdsong rings dissonant in their ears, a nauseating smell invades their nostrils.

They will not be able to catch anyone else today. Although the day is young, the villagers retire early. Except for Beyond_Birthday that is.

It is now Night 6. Deadline for night actions is 9th June, 8am AEST.

Benmage was the one that no one paid attention to.

One would always find him tottering about in Normalville, his eyes always fixed on the ground ahead and muttering about rune combinations, incantation sequences or spirit channeling. PeregerineV would often peer over the fence they shared and see Benmage sitting cross-legged in his backyard, inhumanly still, intensely focusing on a small rock on the grass in front of him.

This was because Benmage thought he had inner magic. In fact, he knew it. He would try to discuss his attempts at using it with anyone who did not make effort to avoid him. However, even those that he caught by surprise would suddenly acquire the urge to "do the grocery shopping", "meet a friend" or "give the cat a bath".

Only DeasVail, despite his conspicuous lack of understanding of the arcane arts, would listen to him, talk to him. He remembers summer afternoons of the two of them sitting side by side, gazing intently at rocks. However, with DeasVail's murder, those days were gone. In the process of packing after DeasVail's death, eager at the opportunity to finally escape Normalville, Benmage paused, and realised how sweet it would be to avenge his one friend's death. He came up with a plan.

Each night, apart from skyping with his neighbours of course, he would work even harder on releasing his magic and when he did manage to levitate that pebble, he would use his newfound magic to destroy the mafia. The plan was flawless!

Each night he would try and fail, and he began to give up hope, started to think it possible that perhaps he was not magical after all, until the sixth night.

~~

Benmage sits at his desk, head sagging against his right palm, struggling to keep his eyes open. He tries alternating their use, rapid blanking, raising an eyebrow while winking, but nothing moves the rock, and it becomes even more difficult to stay awake.

He is suddenly alerted by the rock flying across the room.

I do have magic after all!

Benmage turns, trying to find the rock, and it is a few moments before he notices the figure in the darkness of the next room. He freezes, knows that it is he who is dying that night, but he is amazingly content when he hears the inevitable shot.

Finally someone else knows that I am not just a rambling old fool! he thinks to himself as he dies.

The figure smiles to himself as he leaves the building, magnet in one hand, small iron ball in the other. Despite what the villagers may think, he knows he is not all bad. If he was, he would not have been as kind as he was that night.

Benmage, Town Neighbour, has been killed Night 6.

As the seventh day since DeasVail's death begins, ChaosOmega reflects on how much Normalville had changed in those seven days. Once a slightly crowded place with children seen running from house to house, hearty voices announcing goods for sale and at least some pleasant music, the village was now eery in its silence. Indeed, the the sound of ChaosOmega's steps as he makes his way to the square feels unnatural, the clear blue sky and numerous warm-coloured houses at odds with the lack of activity.

The three remaining villagers are quiet that day, reserved, each knowing that by evening, their fate will be revealed. Eventually, ChaosOmega becomes convinced of CryMeARiver's guilt and suggests his lynch.

Immediately afterward, Slandaar announces his agreement and whips out his pistol, shooting CryMeARiver in the chest.

ChaosOmega's knees collapse and he slumps to the ground, face suddenly hot, mouth slightly open and yet to respond to the sudden turn of events, knowing that his death will surely come next. Only one question presses on his mind.
"Why?" CryMeARiver, not yet dead, asks.

~~

Once upon a time, Slandaar had lived alone in what was to become Normalville, in a house he himself had built, behind a garden he carefully maintained. He did things his own way, and there was not anyone around to complain. That is, until others moved into the area and Normalville was created. From behind his window, Slandaar would eye the first other inhabitants with a small flutter of excitement in his chest. The prospect of change was exciting, with people to work with, converse with, play music with. However, the new villagers found his violin skill unpleasant, his odd habits off-putting, and his quietness and solitude reason for suspicion. It was not long before the villagers stopped seeing Slandaar and would have wondered if he was even managing to keep himself alive, if not for the distinctive music emanating from his house. Slandaar had come to enjoy the responses to his music and while playing, would, with something bordering on ecstasy, imagine the cringes, the frowns, the discomfort.

One day, however, a young man named DeasVail came along, making a mockery of his attempts to torture the village. From behind his curtains, Slandaar found DeasVail's naive grin and youthful gait infuriating. One day, he decided that a change was needed in Normalville, and he would be the one to initiate it.

~~

Slandaar responds with more words than anyone from Normalville had ever heard him say.

"Didn't your eyes light up at the sight of DeasVail dead? Didn't you imagine how much more pleasant Normalville would be. I was doing you all a favour! But no! In self-righteousness you deny your feelings and decide to burn the killers who only made your lives easier."

His face is contorted with anger, but after a moment's silence, laughter begins. Neither ChaosOmega or CryMeARiver have long to attempt to understand. He shoots at both of them until out of bullets and after a second's admiration of his work, returns to his home.

That was fun, he thinks as he opens his house door.

I believe it's time to move.
